function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inadequate air circulation and natural light may lead to high humidity, increasing the risk of viruses sticking and spreading easily.","Impact":"Increased risk of contagious diseases spreading within the living environment.","Mitigation":"Ensure proper ventilation systems and access to natural light, use dehumidifiers if necessary.","Technologies":"HVAC systems, dehumidifiers, natural light optimization technologies.","People":"Residents, visitors, and individuals spending time in the built environment.","Owner":"Architects, building developers, and facility managers."},{"Description":"Inflexible layout design may lead to inadequate access to daylight and natural light, impacting the overall health and well-being of occupants.","Impact":"Reduced physical and mental well-being due to lack of natural light and flexibility in living spaces.","Mitigation":"Implement flexible layout designs, use adjustable partitions and window treatments to optimize natural light, prioritize window placement.","Technologies":"Smart glass, movable partitions, adjustable shading systems.","People":"Occupants and residents of the built environment.","Owner":"Interior designers, architects, and building developers."},{"Description":"Insufficient separation of wet and living spaces may lead to increased risk of cross-contamination and spread of pathogens.","Impact":"Higher risk of infectious diseases spreading within the household.","Mitigation":"Implement clear separation of wet and living spaces, use effective cleaning and disinfection protocols, provide designated areas for cleaning before entering living spaces.","Technologies":"Anti-bacterial materials, touchless fixtures, effective drainage systems.","People":"Household members, visitors, and individuals using the living spaces.","Owner":"Architects, interior designers, and facility managers."},{"Description":"Lack of greenery near living and working areas may impact mental well-being and stress levels of occupants.","Impact":"Reduced psychological well-being and increased stress due to limited access to nature and green spaces.","Mitigation":"Incorporate green spaces and indoor plants, create designated areas for indoor gardening and greenery, optimize access to outdoor views and natural elements.","Technologies":"Indoor gardening systems, biophilic design elements, natural ventilation systems.","People":"Occupants and residents of the built environment.","Owner":"Architects, interior designers, and building developers."}]}
